H0.text: Oxygen levels will increase when trees are removed from a tropical rain forest, affecting other plants and animals.

H1.text: Carbon dioxide levels will increase when trees are removed from a tropical rain forest, affecting other plants and animals.

H2.text: The temperature of Earth will decrease when trees are removed from a tropical rainforest, affecting other plants and animals.

H3.text: The air pollution in the atmosphere will decrease when trees are removed from a tropical rainforest, destroying the habitat and affecting other plants and animals.

A4.text: Deforestation disrupts normal weather patterns creating hotter and drier weather thus increasing drought, desertification, crop failures, melting of the polar ice caps, coastal flooding and displacement of major vegetation regimes.

A5.text: Deforestation... reduces the uptake of carbon dioxide (carbon sequestration) from the atmosphere. This reduces the potential of forests to assist with climate change mitigation.
